subject: Re: [junit] Should I use Cactus or HttpUnit?
msgSnippet: So said  Narendra S  on  2003-07-30 -------------------- ... What about your JSPs do you want to test? Also, don t forget HTMLUnit (compare with HTTPUnit) in
messageBody:
So said Narendra S on 2003-07-30 --------------------

>Hi,
>
>I would like to unit test JSP's. After going through junit.org I understand
>that JSP's can be tested either
>using cactus or HttpUnit. Can you advice me on which tool should I go in
>for? What is the difference between these 2 tools?

What about your JSPs do you want to test?

Also, don't forget HTMLUnit (compare with HTTPUnit) in your search for the right tool.

It's an important question: what does it mean to "unit test" a JSP? To me, the key is to execute the JSP in isolation without any business logic -- simply throw objects into a Request and hit the JSP.

What do *you* want to test?

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
